posts.summary:
“With tender back glistening, 
A green spider runs. 
It carries out its lesson. 
Upon the Weightless web. 

It works without...
posts.caption:
“With tender back glistening,
A green spider runs.
It carries out its lesson.
Upon the Weightless web.

It works without reflecting,
Remembers only this—
The living thread he works on
Leads to his native home.


And to me, the day’s raw weather.
Dictates a bitter line—
I, the homeless tsar of nature,
Envy the little spider.”

From Shadow of a Soul -translated from Russian to English

posts.summary: “I feel like I’m waiting here. Waiting for something that hasn’t happened yet. Something that isn’t yet. But that’s all I feel...
posts.body:
weltenwellen:

“I feel like I’m waiting here. Waiting for something that hasn’t happened yet. Something that isn’t yet. But that’s all I feel and nothing else. I don’t know if I even exist.”

— Katja Millay, The Sea of Tranquility

reblog.tree_html:
weltenwellen:

posts.summary: “You shine so brilliantly bright, but you seem so sad on days when no one is around. It hurts to see you cry, but it hurts...
posts.body:
somepiecesofmyheartandsoul:

“You shine so brilliantly bright, but you seem so sad on days when no one is around. It hurts to see you cry, but it hurts tenfold to see your plastic smile. You wish to be held as you push away the hands that reach out to you, and watch silently as they leave. They wish to know about love, but you wish to know just a little more about yourself.”

— Lukas W. // The one who can’t understand herself
